intro: Sidalcea calycosa, commonly known as the showy milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, bean-like pods that contain its seeds. Sidalcea calycosa is often found in areas with well-drained soil and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
